Authors and Citation
text: Navarro D (2023). codecat: Codebooks Categorical Data. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/djnavarro/codecat.
code: @Manual{,   title = {codecat: Codebooks For Categorical Data},   author = {Danielle Navarro},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/djnavarro/codecat}, }

title: Codebooks For Categorical Data
text: goal codecat provide minimal toolkit defining using codebooks (also called data dictionaries) specify factor levels labels one (usually categorical) variables data set.

title: Codebooks For Categorical Data
text: can install development version codecat like :

title: Codebooks For Categorical Data
text: specify coding scheme variable, use code() function. collection coding schemes applied data set called codebook, created using codebook(): Apply data using encode(): restore original levels, use decode():
code: library(codecat) library(tibble) codebook(   code("SEX", levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Male", "Female")),   code("STUDY", levels = c(1, 2, 3), labels = c("S1", "S2", "S3")) ) #> $SEX #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   variable level label  #>   <chr>    <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 SEX          0 Male   #> 2 SEX          1 Female #>  #> $STUDY #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   variable level label #>   <chr>    <dbl> <chr> #> 1 STUDY        1 S1    #> 2 STUDY        2 S2    #> 3 STUDY        3 S3 dat <- tibble(   STUDY = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2),   SEX   = c(0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0),   AGE   = c(32, 18, 64, 52, 26, 80) )  labels <- codebook(   code("SEX", levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Male", "Female")),   code("STUDY", levels = c(1, 2, 3), labels = c("S1", "S2", "S3")) )  encode(dat, labels) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   STUDY SEX      AGE #>   <fct> <fct>  <dbl> #> 1 S1    Male      32 #> 2 S1    Male      18 #> 3 S1    Female    64 #> 4 S2    Female    52 #> 5 S2    Female    26 #> 6 S2    Male      80 dat2 <- encode(dat, labels) decode(dat2, labels) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   STUDY   SEX   AGE #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     0    32 #> 2     1     0    18 #> 3     1     1    64 #> 4     2     1    52 #> 5     2     1    26 #> 6     2     0    80

title: Define the data coding scheme for a variable — code
code: code("SEX", levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Male", "Female")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   variable level label  #>   <chr>    <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 SEX          0 Male   #> 2 SEX          1 Female

Define a codebook for a collection of variables — codebook
code: codebook(   code("SEX", levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Male", "Female")),   code("STUDY", levels = c(1, 2, 3), labels = c("S1", "S2", "S3")) ) #> $SEX #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   variable level label  #>   <chr>    <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 SEX          0 Male   #> 2 SEX          1 Female #>  #> $STUDY #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   variable level label #>   <chr>    <dbl> <chr> #> 1 STUDY        1 S1    #> 2 STUDY        2 S2    #> 3 STUDY        3 S3    #>

what: Use codebook to recreate original levels from labelled facors — decode
title: Use codebook to recreate original levels from labelled facors — decode
text: Use codebook recreate original levels labelled facors

title: Use codebook to recreate original levels from labelled facors — decode
Use codebook to recreate original levels from labelled facors — decode
text: data data frame tibble codebook codebook

title: Use codebook to recreate original levels from labelled facors — decode
Use codebook to recreate original levels from labelled facors — decode
code: labels <- codebook(   code("SEX", levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Male", "Female")),   code("STUDY", levels = c(1, 2, 3), labels = c("S1", "S2", "S3")) ) dataset <- data.frame(    STUDY = factor(c("S1", "S1", "S1", "S2", "S2", "S2")),    SEX   = factor(c("Male", "Male", "Female", "Female", "Female", "Male")),    AGE   = c(32, 18, 64, 52, 26, 80) ) decode(dataset, labels) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   STUDY   SEX   AGE #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     0    32 #> 2     1     0    18 #> 3     1     1    64 #> 4     2     1    52 #> 5     2     1    26 #> 6     2     0    80

what: Apply a codebook to create labelled factors — encode
title: Apply a codebook to create labelled factors — encode
Apply a codebook to create labelled factors — encode
Apply a codebook to create labelled factors — encode
text: data data frame tibble codebook codebook

title: Apply a codebook to create labelled factors — encode
Apply a codebook to create labelled factors — encode
code: labels <- codebook(   code("SEX", levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Male", "Female")),   code("STUDY", levels = c(1, 2, 3), labels = c("S1", "S2", "S3")) ) dataset <- data.frame(    STUDY = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2),    SEX   = c(0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0),    AGE   = c(32, 18, 64, 52, 26, 80) ) encode(dataset, labels) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   STUDY SEX      AGE #>   <fct> <fct>  <dbl> #> 1 S1    Male      32 #> 2 S1    Male      18 #> 3 S1    Female    64 #> 4 S2    Female    52 #> 5 S2    Female    26 #> 6 S2    Male      80
